qas.question: Where did the group of theorists first meet?

answers.text: length of proof and number of researchers.

plausible_answers.text: Daniel Gorenstein, John G. Thompson and Walter Feit

qas.question: Who founded the University of Chicago's Group Theory Year?
What no longer has much impact on other fields?
What was shorter about this project as compared to other endeavors?
When did the University of Chicago begin?

context: <a0_0>The University of Chicago<a0_0/>'s <a1_0><b8_0>1960–61<b8_0/><a1_0/> Group Theory Year brought together group theorists such as <b5_0>Daniel Gorenstein, John G. Thompson and Walter Feit<b5_0/>, laying the foundation of a collaboration that, with input from numerous other mathematicians, classified <a2_0><b4_0>all finite simple groups<b4_0/><a2_0/> in 1982. This project exceeded previous mathematical endeavours by its sheer size, in both <a3_0><b7_0>length of proof<b7_0/> and number of researchers.<a3_0/> Research is ongoing to simplify the proof of this classification. These days, <b6_0>group theory<b6_0/> is still a highly active mathematical branch, impacting many other fields.a[›]
